intro: Cyanea gibsonii, commonly known as the Gibson's hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Cyanea gibsonii is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and plays an important role in the local ecosystem.
